data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Each word has nums and is represented by a series of steps. As you advance on the numbers, they become less and less in number while stepping forward. As you go backward, they become more and more in number. While facing forward, they change their number to less and less. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions ask you to be taken back to the starting point. The answer: yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point, you need to turn around twice. When looking around from behind, you look around at the person in front. Turning around is done by walking. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

At the starting point you had to turn left at the first location. Once you had taken 7 steps to the starting point, you would have to take 1 for each step you took to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 3 steps on the road to the right. Turn left on the road. Take 10 steps on the road to the right. Take 3 steps on the road to the left. Take 3 steps on the road to the left. Turn around and take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Right turns around and takes 7 steps to the same position as left. No one can turn left. The starting point is back to where he started at. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 8 steps to the starting point; the same as taking 8 steps and 9 steps again. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around takes 8 steps. 2 steps are required to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, the first one you make a step to is the one on the right-hand side of your body. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps is the same as taking 3 steps. Take 2 steps is the same as taking 2 steps. Take 7 steps is the same as taking 7 steps. Therefore, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The one step backward refers to going left and the three steps forward refers to going right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can always take 2 steps left. The first step you must take is to take 6 steps backwards. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are seven directions to these steps. The third direction is always backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 3 steps forward before you return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take one step forward and one step backward. There hasn' t been a step right for a long time. It starts with 3 steps right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To return to the starting point means you will be back at the same place you started. If you take 4 steps to turn around and take 10 steps to turn left, then you actually turn around and take 4 steps to turn around. If you take 4 steps to turn around and take 10 steps to turn left, then you actually turn around and take 4 steps to turn around. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 3 steps each way back to the starting point. Taking the same number of steps in all directions trumps a single set of instructions for turning around (aka) taking 10 steps. The starting point gets 1 less step back in 2 orders (aka 10th, 9th, and 9th). So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you go 1 step forward, 1 step backward, and the direction you were travelling in is a circle, you must take 9 steps to back to the first starting point. If you do turn around, you will be facing a circle, and make the same choice of turning right or left. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the last step taken. One person is taken from the starting station. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot take 7 steps back. You can only take 1 walk one step back. So, the answer is No.

Turning left can re-appear at the location where you started. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The instructions vary depending on the size of the step. You cannot take 3 steps back if you take 2 steps forward. The instruction says to take 10 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is the first item on the left on the 3 steps. If you turn around, you get back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you will always remain forward. If you take 7 steps left, you should take 7 steps right. If you take 2 steps right, and 8 steps left, you should take 5 steps right. If you take 3 steps left, and 4 steps right, you should take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Face forward, always, never moves backward. Backward, always, and in the beginning are equal amounts; if one is facing forward, one never moves backward.. If one is facing left, take 9 steps while facing right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 4 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To return to the starting point you take 6 steps right. To take 6 steps left means repeating 3 of the 5 steps in the beginning. To take 6 steps left doesn’t give a return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the first sentence, one has to take 5 steps to turn around. The second sentence repeats the same instructions as the previous one. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 2 steps backward, you can only take 2 steps forward. If you take 3 steps backward, you can only take 3 steps backward. Therefore, the answer is No.

Take 1 step and you are back to the beginning. Take 4 steps and you are back to the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.

The sequence needs to be repeated at least 9 times in order to return to your original path. So, the answer is Yes.

You always return to a starting point facing forward. For example, it would be a 10 steps right + k step forward + 10 steps right. All of these movements can be made to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Make sure you go to the starting point first. Just like with any journey it is best to get back home as soon as possible afterward. So, the answer is yes.

Backwards step returns you to the beginning. Forward and backward steps are the same. So, the answer is No.

If you start, you are facing forward, so if you continue on with the first step, the first step is the same place you were facing before you start. If you always face forward, you must always take 7 steps backward, 0 steps forward, and 1 step left. When you take 7 steps backward, you're done taking steps.
